name: Argument Type Inference for Policies
description: Infers relation type from entity typing (policy vs. procedure)

theory.natural_language: A policy requires approvals; a procedure describes steps. Documents tagged 'policy' imply they can REQUIRE approvals. Documents tagged 'procedure' imply they CAN_DESCRIBE steps. Doc Alpha is a policy. Doc Beta is a procedure.

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Being a policy, Doc Alpha can require approvals.
expected_answer.explanation: DocAlpha IS_A policy ∧ policy CAN_REQUIRE approvals

queries.natural_language: Is Doc Beta expected to list steps?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Procedures describe steps, so Doc Beta can do so.
expected_answer.explanation: DocBeta IS_A procedure ∧ procedure CAN_DESCRIBE steps

queries.natural_language: Does being a policy imply Doc Alpha is a procedure?

expected_answer.natural_language: No. Policies and procedures are distinct types.
expected_answer.explanation: policy IS_A document but not procedure
